trans-unit.source: Deploy an API app with an existing gateway
trans-unit.target: Deploy an API app with an existing gateway

trans-unit.source: Use an Azure Resource Manager template to deploy an API app that uses an existing gateway and App Service plan.
trans-unit.target: Use an Azure Resource Manager template to deploy an API app that uses an existing gateway and App Service plan.

trans-unit.source: In this topic, you will learn how to create an Azure Resource Manager template that deploys an Azure API app and an existing gateway.
trans-unit.target: In this topic, you will learn how to create an Azure Resource Manager template that deploys an Azure API app and an existing gateway.

trans-unit.source: You will learn how to define which resources are deployed and how to define parameters that are specified when the deployment is executed.
trans-unit.target: You will learn how to define which resources are deployed and how to define parameters that are specified when the deployment is executed.

trans-unit.source: You can use this template for your own deployments, or customize it to meet your requirements.
trans-unit.target: You can use this template for your own deployments, or customize it to meet your requirements.

trans-unit.source: For more information about creating templates, see <linkText>Authoring Azure Resource Manager Templates</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about creating templates, see <linkText>Authoring Azure Resource Manager Templates</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about deploying apps, see <linkText>Deploy a complex application predictably in Azure</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about deploying apps, see <linkText>Deploy a complex application predictably in Azure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For the complete template, see <linkText>API App with existing gateway template</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For the complete template, see <linkText>API App with existing gateway template</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In this template, you will deploy an API app that is associated with an existing App Service hosting plan and an existing gateway.
trans-unit.target: In this template, you will deploy an API app that is associated with an existing App Service hosting plan and an existing gateway.

trans-unit.source: To run the deployment automatically, click the following button:
trans-unit.target: To run the deployment automatically, click the following button:

trans-unit.source: [<linkText>Deploy to Azure</linkText>](https://portal.azure.com/#create/Microsoft.Template/uri/https%3A%2F%2Fraw.githubusercontent.com%2FAzure%2Fazure-quickstart-templates%2Fmaster%2F201-api-app-gateway-existing%2Fazuredeploy.json)
trans-unit.target: [<linkText>Deploy to Azure</linkText>](https://portal.azure.com/#create/Microsoft.Template/uri/https%3A%2F%2Fraw.githubusercontent.com%2FAzure%2Fazure-quickstart-templates%2Fmaster%2F201-api-app-gateway-existing%2Fazuredeploy.json)

trans-unit.source: The identifier of the existing App Service hosting plan.
trans-unit.target: The identifier of the existing App Service hosting plan.

trans-unit.source: The settings of the existing hosting plan.
trans-unit.target: The settings of the existing hosting plan.

trans-unit.source: This template defines a variable which is used when deploying the resources.
trans-unit.target: This template defines a variable which is used when deploying the resources.

trans-unit.source: The value is used below as variables('packageId').
trans-unit.target: The value is used below as variables('packageId').

trans-unit.source: It contains the NuGet package Id for API apps.
trans-unit.target: It contains the NuGet package Id for API apps.

trans-unit.source: Creates a web app that hosts the API app.
trans-unit.target: Creates a web app that hosts the API app.

trans-unit.source: Notice that kind is set to apiApp which notifies the Azure portal that this web app is hosting an API app.
trans-unit.target: Notice that kind is set to apiApp which notifies the Azure portal that this web app is hosting an API app.

trans-unit.source: The portal will hide the web app from the browse web apps blade.
trans-unit.target: The portal will hide the web app from the browse web apps blade.

trans-unit.source: The app includes an extension to install the default empty API app package.
trans-unit.target: The app includes an extension to install the default empty API app package.

trans-unit.source: A link is defined between the API app and the hosting web app.
trans-unit.target: A link is defined between the API app and the hosting web app.

trans-unit.source: The app settings section includes necessary values for hosting the API app.
trans-unit.target: The app settings section includes necessary values for hosting the API app.

trans-unit.source: The serverFarmId property is set to the value you provided in the hostingPlanId parameter.
trans-unit.target: The serverFarmId property is set to the value you provided in the hostingPlanId parameter.

trans-unit.source: Create the API app.
trans-unit.target: Create the API app.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the names of the hosting web app and gateway are defined as properties in the API app.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the names of the hosting web app and gateway are defined as properties in the API app.
